Claims.Text: due to the limitation of technology renewable resources are relatively expensive
these new forms of energy may not be as clean and green as we think
contemporarily fossil fuels cause serious environmental conundrums such as acid rain, deduction of ozone layer and global warming

Premises.Text: Researches in renewable energy cost a huge amount of money which developing countries cannot afford
fossil fuels are abundant and inexpensive in many areas
it is estimated that China has the largest deposit of coal in the world and the government does not want to invest too much money on new forms of energy, say expensive solar batteries and wind farms
the plan of renewable resources of energy may face challenges in that not every country can afford the reforming
utility companies claim that renewable energy is environmentally friendly
Latest studies have shown that these renewable resources of energy are problematic as well and they are very likely to pose long-term environmental hazards
the dams built for hydroelectricity influence the water flows of the rivers and sometimes cause drought in areas in front of the dams
This damages the habitats of many valuable fish and wading birds
the accumulation of heavy metal in the silt on the bottom of the rivers behind the dams is extremely difficult and expensive to clean up; leaving problems for the following generations
renewable resources are not as reliable as we think
these problems can be solved by improving efficiency of the mechanism and reducing emissions
we can use chemicals to desulfurize the emissions from plants and vehicles to avoid acid rain
These improving methods are often cheaper and simpler compared to the high-tech of renewable energy
With these solutions fossil fuels seem more sustainable
